products.title: Onions
products.description:
An onion weighs 100 grams on average. Depending on the variety, its weight varies, but also its shape, very round, elongated or slightly flattened, and its color, yellow, red or white: a veritable string of colors and aspects!
 French production is mainly concentrated in the north of the country, even if it is present on almost all of its terroirs. Only 2 out of 10 cultivated onions are early onions. 
 Main ingredient or flavor enhancer, the onion is omnipresent in our kitchens, always at hand. 
With a low caloric intake, the nutritional qualities of this vegetable are recognized. Rich in vitamins, minerals, trace elements and fibre, it is a source of well-being and balance.

products.specificity:
The sweet potato is a large tuber with white or orange flesh. His skin is purplish-red.
 She is the real potato, and, biologically speaking, she has nothing to do with the potato.
 Nevertheless, it is cooked… like the potato, even if it is eaten in both sweet and savory preparations.
 Its slightly sweet flavor is reminiscent of carrots, chestnuts or even artichoke bottoms.

products.title: Potato
products.description:
A potato weighs between 80 and 320 grams depending on the size. The color of the skin and flesh varies from pale yellow to purple to pink. More or less large, the potato has a pulp with different textures depending on the variety.
 With a moderate caloric intake, the potato is very rich in carbohydrates. It also provides vitamins and nutrients. It is a real source of energy in winter.

 Low in calories, but rich in vitamins! Celery is a concentrate of essential nutrients, including calcium and vitamin C, essential nutrients for your daily tone.
 Bitten or cooked, the celery stalk pleasantly flavors all your dishes. Remember to reserve more space for it in your daily recipes, you will be surprised by its aromatic breadth.

products.specificity:
A cabbage weighs 2 kg on average. Green, white or red, headed cabbage includes different varieties with smooth and dense foliage or large ribbed green leaves. This vegetable develops a distinctive taste in the mouth.
 With a low energy content, cabbage is a vegetable very rich in vitamins. It also provides fiber, thus constituting a vegetable ally of your well-being.
 Cabbage is eaten in different ways, associated with rustic and traditional dishes as well as more refined preparations. Most often steamed, it is quick and easy to prepare.

products.description:
Fresh eggs from pullets.
 Product is currently not available for lagos shipping.
 Only crate SKU is available for Ibadan delivery

products.title: Green pepper
products.description:
A variety of sweet pepper, the pepper produces large, fresh and colorful fruits.
 The color palette ranges from bright green to dark brown, passing through golden yellow or vermilion.
 The range of flavors ranges from bitter-pepper to sweet.

products.title: parsley
products.description:
Parsley is a very fragrant aromatic herb: just rub it between your fingers to feel its characteristic fragrance caressing your nostrils. It exudes a warm, herbaceous flavor.
 Of a beautiful shiny green, its leaves form three narrow lobes. There are two main varieties of parsley: flat, tastier, and curly, more decorative. A third variety, less known, is consumed completely differently, it is tuberous parsley.
 Simple to integrate into a recipe, it is probably the most used herb in the kitchen.
 Parsley is one of your privileged well-being partners: just picked, it releases many nutrients.

products.title: Eggplant
products.description:
An eggplant weighs 225 g on average. Its color, size and shape vary depending on the variety. The most common on the stalls is the purple eggplant, with white and soft flesh.
 Low in calories, eggplant contains fiber, minerals and vitamins in significant amounts. This vegetable colors and vitaminizes your dishes all summer long!
 Eggplant is an easy-going vegetable that is easy to cook. Its melting flesh goes well with a large number of savory preparations.
 Eggplant is one of the emblematic vegetables of sunny days and of Mediterranean cuisine.

products.title: Sorrel
products.description:
A perennial herb, sorrel is distinguished by its spearhead-shaped leaf.
 Fresh, tangy and sparkling, it is an original in many culinary preparations.
 A true concentrate of micronutrients, it is recognized for its benefits… even in small quantities.

products.title: Sorrel
products.description:
Plante annuelle, ses nombreuses variétés permettent d’en consommer de janvier à décembre.
 Avec la mâcheet la chicorée, la laitue constitue la troisième grande famille de salade.
 Peu calorique, elle vous apporte une grande variété de minéraux et d’oligo-éléments. Également riche en fibres, sa teneur en vitamine C n’est pas négligeable.
 En France, la laitue est le quatrième légume le plus produit, derrière la tomate, la carotteet le chou-fleur. Sa culture se répartit sur l’ensemble du territoire.

products.title: green bean
products.description:
Long thin pod, more or less stretched, the green bean is classified into 3 categories: filet, mange-tout and filet mange-tout.
 French production is mainly located in the west of the country. In winter, green beans are mainly imported from Morocco and Kenya.
 Some green beans are… yellow: butter beans!
 Boiled or steamed, green beans are delicious with eggs, and go well with both meat and fish. Il est riche en minéraux et en vitamines

products.title: garlic
products.description:
A head of garlic weighs 80 grams per head on average. A head contains 10 to 12 cloves. Its color covers a palette ranging from white to bright pink. Once peeled, the pod reveals a slightly shiny and very fragrant flesh.
 Its strong flavor easily integrates your savory preparations for a limited calorie intake.
 Raw or cooked, chopped, in strips or in a shirt, garlic lends itself to many gourmet variations by enhancing the taste of your recipes.
 On the stalls all year round, garlic keeps perfectly to accommodate it in all ways throughout the seasons!

products.title: spinach
products.description:
spinach is a vegetable plant whose green leaves are eaten.
 Spinach grows in just a few weeks. More resistant hybrid varieties have gradually supplanted the hardy Géant d’hiver and Monstrueux de Viroflay… 
 Legend has it that spinach is extremely rich in iron. The reality is more moderate, but its fiber and vitamin intake is very interesting.

products.title: Watermelon
products.description:
A watermelon weighs between 3 and 4 kg. This large spherical fruit covered with a thick striped green skin conceals a deep red pulp. Its flesh, slightly crunchy and not very sweet, is very thirst-quenching.
 Watermelon is very high in water and low in calories. This vitamin-rich fruit is your fitness asset on sunny days.
 This thirst-quenching fruit is delicious when crunched, cut into large, juicy and gourmet wedges. Cut into cubes or balls, watermelon goes well with other fruits, raw vegetables, mint... for refreshing recipes.
 Originally from Africa, the watermelon literally feeds on heat.
 The potato is only eaten cooked. It lends itself to many gourmet preparations, pan-fried, steamed, mashed, baked or in soup.
